name: places/ChIJFRN2qgH2wokR5SIjF6c-T1Q
adrFormatAddress: 2090 1st Ave., New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text: Early last year my Son and I did a tour/classroom observation for their integrated classroom. The special ed teacher said my Son was smart and knew alot but felt he was not a fit for the classroom because he couldn't sit down, he just turned 3 years old, he was never in a school setting before and not use to structure and routine. The special education teacher was not friendly or engaging, she didn't look happy and she was young so I knew she didnt have alot of teaching experience. When I directed my concerns to the director her excuse was the teacher is young, this is her first teaching experience and she is Arab or East Indian so in their culture they are not outgoing and don't show emotion. I'm so glad they didn't want my son in their school because now his in a school as well in a integrated classroom who gave him a chance. His doing good Now after a couple of tough weeks. Now a days teachers do not want to work and give  children a opportunity to succeed.

originalText.text: My child has learned so much from the teachers and the environment in just a few months. I am amazed on how quickly he has picked up and how fantastic he continues to do at home.

originalText.text: Dawning Village is the place to be.
